intro: Melochia cinerea, commonly known as the pale melochia, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, grayish-green leaves and showy, yellow-centered flowers. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in disturbed soils or along roadsides.
